page.title: 20TRANSPORT IN/AROUND CHAGFORD
page.content: In an area such as this one's own transport is something of a necessity. Public services exist in the form of {buses}to{Exeter, Okehampton and Newton {Abbot,}but these are few and far between. The nearest{train}service is in{Exeter}where there is also an{Air_ {port.} A{Taxi}service is available in Chagford but the traffic problems referred to elsewhere illustrate the fact that most people have their own {cars.}An occasional{bicycle}may be seen (but the hilly nature of the roads is not conducive to this mode of transport) as may a{horse. Tractors,} too are not uncommon as a means of getting around and have decided advan_ tages in icy and snowy conditions. .....................................{ {Survey completed by Class 5R of Chag_ {ford C of E Primary School, with Mr. {G.S. Reynolds, Head Teacher. }
